Mishima's meditation (or is that masturbation?) on duty and suicide 
"Patriotism" was made into a short film, the seppuku scene was said to 
last ten to fifteen minutes. The family destroyed all copies so as far 
as we know none exist at this time. The same year he died, he appeared 
in "Hitokiri" starring Katsu Shintaro as Okada Izo. Mishima played 
Tanaka Shinbei a real life ronin who killed himself when confronted by 
the police, check it out.
	Another method of seppuku, for the battlefield, was to grip the 
wakizashi with right hand reversed, passing the blade behind the head, 
laying the cutting edge on the neck and pull. The left hand could be 
placed on the back of the blade to insure a deep cut. Remember Nobunaga 
walked into the heart of a conflagration rather than give himself up, I 
think most would agree his was an honorable choice.
